sentence: Looking at the universe of stocks we cover at Dividend Channel , on 1/18/18, Oxford Industries, Inc. (Symbol: OXM), Procter & Gamble Company (Symbol: PG), and Foot Locker, Inc. (Symbol: FL) will all trade ex-dividend for their respective upcoming dividends.

Oxford Industries, Inc. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.27 on 2/2/18, Procter & Gamble Company will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.6896 on 2/15/18, and Foot Locker, Inc. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.31 on 2/2/18.

As a percentage of OXM's recent stock price of $82.51, this dividend works out to approximately 0.33%, so look for shares of Oxford Industries, Inc. to trade 0.33% lower - all else being equal - when OXM shares open for trading on 1/18/18.
Similarly, investors should look for PG to open 0.76% lower in price and for FL to open 0.64% lower, all else being equal.
Below are dividend history charts for OXM, PG, and FL, showing historical dividends prior to the most recent ones declared.
In general, dividends are not always predictable, following the ups and downs of company profits over time.
Therefore, a good first due diligence step in forming an expectation of annual yield going forward, is looking at the history above, for a sense of stability over time.
This can help in judging whether the most recent dividends from these companies are likely to continue.
If they do continue, the current estimated yields on annualized basis would be 1.31% for Oxford Industries, Inc., 3.05% for Procter & Gamble Company , and 2.57% for Foot Locker, Inc..
In Tuesday trading, Oxford Industries, Inc. shares are currently up about 0.3%, Procter & Gamble Company shares are up about 0.9%, and Foot Locker, Inc. shares are up about 1.6% on the day.
